bug.author: 14sudharsan
bug.description:
/kind bug
I am trying to install kubeflow v0.6 version on existing gke cluster followed by this link <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link>
steps which i have done root@741f34c1c079:# export KFAPP=kfnew root@741f34c1c079:# kfctl init ${KFAPP} --config=${CONFIG} -V INFO[0000] Downloading <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.1/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.1/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml</denchmark-link> to /tmp/799858158/app.yaml filename="v1alpha1/application_types.go:334" WARN[0001] Overriding KfDef.Spec.Name; comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/14sudharsan>@14sudharsan</denchmark-link> can you please check or list down your user's associated clusterroles? This looks like a clusterrole issue on first sight. Could you please check if this user has enough privileges to create role resources and can create resources in istio-system namespace?
Hi, can you describe how you listed the cluster roles and how you added privileges to your user to resolve this issue? Thank you
